newsitem.title: NEPAL: Encephalitis disease kills at least 115 in Nepal.
newsitem.headline: Encephalitis disease kills at least 115 in Nepal.

text.p: An outbreak of encephalitis has killed at least 115 people in 15 districts in Nepal in last five months, a government official said on Monday.

"A total of 624 people have been affected by the disease," Benu Bahadur Karki, head of Nepal's epidemiology department told Reuters while confirming a report published in the state-owned daily Gorkhapatra.
The newspaper said the disease was caused by mosquitoes and had mainly affected districts of Jhapa, Morang, Rupandehi and Banke, all bordering with India.
Banke in west Nepal with 25 victims was worst hit.
A patient affected by encephalitis germs usually suffers from high fever, severe headaches and drowsiness and dies in five days, doctors said.
Karki said the authorities were helpless as there was no special drug for the disease and hospitals outside the capital, Kathmandu, were ill-equipped to counter the epidemic.
